Name: part_of
Description: A relationship ontology term in which the subject is but part of the object.

Name: has_part
Description: A core relation that holds between a whole and its part. The subject has_part object.

Name: participates_in
Description: A relation between a continuant and a process, in which the continuant is somehow involved in the process, e.g., this input material (or this output material) participates in this process.

Name: catalyzes
Description: A relation between a process and an enzyme where a target is catalyzed by the enzyme in a catalytic reaction.

Name: relationship type
Description: Connectedness between entities and/or interactions representing their relatedness or influence (paraphrased from Systems Biology Ontology).

Name: derives_from
Description: A relationship ontology term in which the subject has its origins from the object.

Name: regulates
Description: A relationship ontology term in which the subject regulates expression of the object.

Name: negatively_regulates
Description: A direct interaction that decreases the activity, expression, or function of a target gene, protein, or pathway. This typically involves mechanisms such as repression, inhibition, or suppression.

Name: positively_regulates
Description: A direct interaction that increases the activity, expression, or function of a target gene, protein, or pathway. This often involves activation, stimulation, or enhancement.

Name: evolutionary_variant_of
Description: Gene or protein is an evolutionary variant of a parent.

Name: indirectly_positively_regulates
Description: An indirect interaction that results in an increase in the activity, expression, or function of a target gene, protein, or pathway. This regulation occurs through intermediaries or cascades rather than direct interaction.

Name: indirectly_negatively_regulates
Description: An indirect interaction that results in a decrease in the activity, expression, or function of a target gene, protein, or pathway. This regulation occurs through intermediaries or cascades rather than direct interaction.

Name: represses_expression_of
Description: A relationship between a transcriptional regulator and a gene or gene product, in which the regulator is plays a negative role in the transcriptional process.

Name: is_small_molecule_inhibitor_of
Description: A relation between a continuant and a process, in which the continuant is a small molecule that inhibits the process.

Name: indirectly_regulates
Description: An interaction that broadly affects multiple genes, proteins, or pathways, through intermediaries or cascades rather than direct interaction. Global regulators typically have widespread or systemic impacts on cellular processes, i.e. p indirectly regulates q if p is indirectly causally upstream of q and p regulates q.

Name: is_a
Description: An axiomatic relationship ontology term in which the subject is placed into a higher order classification.
